alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Coastal Cameron; Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Jim Hogg; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 14 at 2:06PM CST until January 15 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...Dangerous Fire Weather Conditions Expected On Saturday... .A strong cold front will push through Deep South Texas and the Rio Grande Valley Saturday morning. Critical fire weather conditions will quickly occur behind the front as strong north to northwest winds develop and relative humidity values rapidly fall through the day. Erratic spread of wildfires is likely should any fire ignite. Conditions will improve Saturday evening as wind speeds weaken. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 6 PM CST SATURDAY FOR FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND STRONG NORTHERLY WINDS FOR ALL OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS... The National Weather Service in Brownsville has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 6 AM to 6 PM CST Saturday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...Zapata, Jim Hogg, Brooks, Inland Kenedy, Starr, Southern Hidalgo, Inland Willacy, Inland Cameron, Coastal Willacy, Coastal Cameron, Coastal Kenedy, and Northern Hidalgo Counties. * TIMING...6 AM until 6 PM Saturday. * WIND...North to Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * HUMIDITY...Falling between 15 and 20 percent for inland locations and 20 to 30 percent for coastal locations. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means critical fire weather conditions are occurring now...or will shortly. In general...these conditions include sustained 20 foot winds of 25 MPH or greater...humidity ranging from below 25 percent in Zapata County to below 45 percent along the coast...each lasting for 2 hours or longer... and cured fuels. Humidity below 25 percent in most areas will trigger fire danger at lower wind speeds. Detailed decision tables are found at HTTP://WEATHER.GOV/RGV/?N=MAPCOLORS#FIRE.
